text: I tried the search API but it doesn't return any associations. I checked the docs but couldn't find the way to enable it... Here's the post I made on HubSpot dev community. I didn't get any reply there so I posted it here.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Viewing-associated-contacts-in-deals-search-CRM-v3/m-p/379042#M37258>
Is it possible to show search result number and query title? Like this?
Yup. That's possible with doing some tweaks in code.. but Can you please share your search page link... so I can get better idea?
Its the default HS search page
<@U012W4YEUTX> - thank you
can you set a field on the form which is hidden from the user and pre-set by your code? then you could find it is set for that contact's record on the backend later

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Feature-request-Auto-update-currency-conversion-rates/idi-p/319268>

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Improved-currency-handling/idi-p/317262>

Looks like there are some known issues here, might have to do something creative like Selenium

Combine with

*<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/associations/%s/%s/batch/read>*

*or*

*<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/%s>* *`/crm/v3/objects/deals/{dealId}`*

with

'associations' param set

works the same on other objs besides deals too

How can I un-sanitize a toast message?  I’m not sure if API is the right forum for this Application integration question, please advise if there’s a better one.
I have a “Copy Deal” button that shows up  on Deal pages.  When clicked, my cloud function returns :  {status: ‘success’, message: ‘Deal <a href=‘<dealUrl>‘>ABC12</a>’ created.}  HubSpot shows the message in a green toast but it doesn’t show the link, instead it sanitizes it, I assume, and the user sees the HTML code instead.  How can I tell HubSpot to not sanitize the link?

we are randomly getting this error when trying to send a draft to the blog, and to send it we had to get information about the blog, author and topics which worked fine. So it makes no sense that we can use part of the api and not the rest.
`Not engaged, auth is missing`
just checking if there is some common thing that changed (we haven't changed anything in a long time, and this exact thing used to work) before we do a deep dive
What format should dates be for the Search API filters?
I’ve tried mirroring the format of the data returned, but that doesn’t work - it looks like it’s expecting a certain format

for example, this doesn’t work:
`'filter_groups': [{'filters': [{'operator': 'GTE', 'property_name': 'closedate','value': '2019-10-10'}]}]`
James, try Unix date formats
this error: `year 1603129930 is out of range: 1603129930`
if I just use ‘2019’ it accepts the year
but that value is a datetime
Is there a way to determine if the logged in user is a paying HubSpot customer through the API?
James, I was just taking a guess because that is the format that I have used for creating deals.  None of our searches have used a date so far.
v2 of the filemanager upload just doesn't work anymore, gives a 404
and docs for v2 show using v3, but then it's not backwards compatible because it must be different since what was working now gives "Unsupported Media Type"
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Unable-to-change-market-place-logo-image-upload-error/m-p/379660>
pretty sure the api has issues right now, this along with our first issue
Robbo, make sure you supply a content type.  <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/415-Unsupported-Media-Type-when-POST-a-contact/td-p/340336>
or maybe the v2 api could just work?
I can't even upvote that issue I linked because when I click "sign in you community" it just redirects me to my test accounts and then nothing happens

how can such a big company have such trash docs, support (they rely on community instead of hire people) and a broken API for over 24 hours without anyone noticing. what a joke, leaving this slack where they clearly just wanted to rely more on community helping each other instead of spending money to actually support devs

Hey <@U01CPCRFB70> sorry you are having issues.  We announced a <http://(https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/updates-for-the-cms-files-api|change to the files api> a bit ago, sounds like we could have done a better job about making sure everyone knew about this change. We also sent out some direct emails, those appear to have missed you as well.

If you’d like, feel free to direct message me so we can look at why you aren’t able to access the community and why you might have been missed from our email list so we can do better next time.

Thanks, <@U012W4YEUTX>.  My understanding is that the issue I was seeking to solve didn't necessarily exists and all things were fine on the post.  Apparently it was a combination of utm construction and test aliases for contacts.
to be honest, those changes have been communicated quite well in my opinion…to those who listen to what is changing ;)… i am not working with API´s  but i have read about the changes more than once
<@U01CPCRFB70> if Zack is unable to help with the Community login, I am also here to help.  Sorry that you are having a bad experience.
there has also been an entire webinar where all the API changes have been discussed :slightly_smiling_face:

The APi gives and receives standard ISO Javascript DateTime formats like:
const date = new Date(“2020-1642T8:00:00Z”);

We are also seeing <@U01CPCRFB70>’s issue with blog posts not being able to be created:
```{"correlationId":"4e6b3629-8425-4a74-8b33-9211d68e928b","errorType":"MISSING_AUTH","message":"Not engaged, auth is missing","status":"error"}```
Anyone know anything about that?  It’s not intermittent for us. Every call gets this problem.
This is an older app using V2 API.
I tried uninstalling the app from Integrations screen, then redid the OAuth flow to permit app. Same problem still.  READ and UPDATE operations are fine. Just not CREATE (POST)
interesting - the ISO format works for all datetime fields I’ve tried - except for `closedate`
wait - the unix timestamp does seem to work
lol, but not LT or LTE date math
only GT(E)
